result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica Rae Irish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs on Count 1 shall be paid from bond. Bond applied to court costs, court-appointed attorney fees and GAL fees in 22JC2 and 22JC3.
Court waives costs on remaining counts.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall not go upon the property of CM / DM in Bagley.  Defendant may have contact with CM/DM but that contact shall occur only between the hours of 8am and 8pm. The defendant shall not engage in harassing conduct, the definition of harassment being that from Section 813.125(1)(am)(2).  That being engaging in a course of conduct or repeatedly committing acts which harass or intimidate another person and which serve no legitimate purpose. The legitimate purpose here is to organize contact between defendant and her children and for the CM/DM to inquire about Ms. Irish's well-being

records.addlTxt: Plea and sentencing hearing (partial) judge's sentence 9/7/2022
Probation sentence vacated

Defendant Jessica Rae Irish in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Kieler in court for defendant. Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant wishes to vacate probation. Court reviews rights re vacating probation and vacates probation. State requests 90 days jail, each count concurrent, with huber, one set court costs, consecutive to other sentences. Attorney Kieler heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 90 days jail on Count 1 and 1 year jail on Count 2, concurrent to each other and 22CF77, 22CF82 & 22CF91. Huber granted. One set court costs. Credit of 49 days plus credit amount on prior judgment.
Hearing on September 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

for court appointed attorney fees

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jessica Rae Irish in court.  Attorney Lisa Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Kieler in court for Jessica Rae Irish. There is no agreement in this case. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest to charges. Defendant and Attorney Kieler have short discussion. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of charges. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State remains silent as to sentencing. Attorney Ryan Kieler heard on sentencing. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 2 years probation for Ct 1 and 1 year probation for Ct 2. with the following conditions: Defendant shall not go upon the property of CM / DM in Bagley.  Defendant may have contact with CM/ DM but that contact shall occur only between the hours of 8am and 8pm. The defendant shall not engage in harassing conduct, the definition of harassment being that from Section 813.125(1)(am)(2).  That being engaging in a course of conduct or repeatedly committing acts which harass or intimidate another person and which serve no legitimate purpose. The legitimate purpose here is to organize contact between defendant and her children and for the CM/DM to inquire about Ms. Irish's well-being; to have such assessment, treatment, counseling, and programming that DOC deems appropriate, to pay 1 set of court costs, and to submit a DNA sample. If revoked, 8 days credit.

Defendant Jessica Rae Irish in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Kieler in court for Jessica Rae Irish. Matter is resolved, Attorney Kieler requests a plea and sentencing date. Plea and sentencing date set.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jessica Rae Irish appeared by phone.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Kieler in court for Jessica Rae Irish. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Court binds matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty to all counts. Status date set.
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Jessica Irish appeared in court. Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared in court. Attorney Anthony Pozorski appeared in court. Court heard on competency evaluation. Attorney Kieler does not object to the findings. State requests that she be found competent. Court heard and finds defendant competent.

Defendant Jessica Rae Irish in court, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kieler appeared in court. Attorney Kieler heard on motion. Court reviews complaint and finds that there was probable cause. Court orders competency exam. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on June 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Jessica Rae Irish appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Court will address attorney on Thursday with other pending cases. State recommends $1000 cash bond. Court orders $1000 cash bond. Status as to counsel.
Status conference on April 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
